author: sarod.sasidharan
title: Cardano coffee - Regional languages
description: India is a multilingual country where a large section of the population speak and understand just their mother tongue.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal effectively identifies a problem to be solved within the challenge that is the lack of content in languages ​​that the people of India understand, the solution is clearly detailed in a simple and effective way and it is explained how it will add value to the cardano ecosystem, the metrics of the proposal are aligned to those of the challenge.

If implemented, the proposal has the potential to significantly increase awareness of cardano in India.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal highlights language barriers as one of the main issues holding back adoption and awareness of Cardano, which are largely the entire goal of the Challenge: increasing local awareness of Cardano in local languages. In the region that is the second largest crypto market in the world, with merely 12% of Indians having English knowledge, and even fewer than that with levels of fluency to understand current Cardano resources, the proposal makes a strong case for its ability to help expand Cardano into India. 

The proposal breaks down a powerful case for why it has directed efforts to the chosen languages – for maximal efficacy and reach/scope – which seems to have the best efficiency of funding to reach the majority of the millions of IT professionals and developers already in the target regions. 

This is a very well-written Proposal, covering areas that other translation proposals of this Campaign are not, and their three-Track approach, each broken into actionable pieces, seems like a great way to have strong Impact for this Challenge all over India including even, as mentioned, rural regions via mobile phones. 

The content-creation Track, the interaction channels like Discord and a website of the accessibility Track, and the promotion Track including even newspapers for folks who are not as well social-media connected, seem like an ideal multi-pronged approach to have great impact in recruiting the next generation of Catalyst proposers, Plutus developers, and more for Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
The listed team seems to have impressive credentials and experience and fluency in exactly what they propose to do. Each member has their LinkedIn or GitHub profiles available, with years of expertise in their respective fields. By virtue of each team member having the expertise in a different language, there appears to be an “economy of scale” in rendering these translations cheaper than if other routes were used, which is emphasized by the proposal. 
The team has spelled out a step-by-step process of which Cardano materials to translate first, and a well thought out roadmap of what to expect each month. They seem to have not only done a good job of specifying what to expect for each date, but also have proven their ability to make this plan become reality. 

The cost breakdown seems quite practical and well planned with a project manager, front-end, back-end developers, translators, and even support all lined up. Looking through the credentials of everyone and this very well spelled out timetable, I feel full confidence in the team’s ability to make this come to life. That is, this project has phenomenal Feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2:
This proposal has nicely broken down what to expect at each time point, from the beginning of their website launch to user counts expectations to Catalyst engagement increases, as well as less-measurable items like awareness increase and enthusiasm for Cardano as a whole. The KPIs spelled out don’t just include what this team will be preparing and creating, but even go so far as to mention blog, Twitter, and YouTube engagement. I would measure this project as highly auditable, largely due to the monthly breakdown of what to expect. 

The only thing that I could imagine further enhancing the auditability of this proposal would be between the outset and month 3 having a way to check in on what work has been made or produced yet on the website, but I would assume with the talent and experience laid out in previous sections that upon request the team should easily be able to update any auditors on what code has been written so far, or see the Set 1 translations spelled out for Month 1 and what Discord and socials have already been established.

f6_assessments.q0: Creating content in the local language is important to make Cardano more accessible. As someone who lived in many countries, I can appreciate the need and the importance of it.  The proposal identifies a problem and an opportunity within the challenge which needs to be approached. It well explains the motivation and the target market.  The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the Cardano ecosystem why it is important for Cardano. The key metrics and goals of the proposal align with the outlined challenge settings and they well explained the alignment. The proposal did suggest how to scale it in the future building courses from the content with some initial idea for further funding but more elaboration on about it would have been helpful considering that content translations will be a going expense. The request for funds is about 20% of the challenge which is high also considering challenge success definition: “Success is having multiple submissions for Catalyst Fund8 for India focused projects, with real-world projects getting funded and built.” They could have asked for a smaller amount and translated for example 2 languages to prove the model and the impact and then go into more languages.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal is very well written and the proposer provides evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal. The proposer knows, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal. The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items. As mentioned above the budget seems high for the purpose of the proposal. It does seem reasonable if we consider 5 languages, but it is not what will be the amount of translated data for $750 per month per language. The proposer also mentioned that KPI of 100 people in 4 months in the communication channels, if we divide it per language it is 20, what will be the numbers in 6 months? Otherwise, it might seem low for the investment required. Based on my entrepreneurial experience, I would have recommended focusing on fewer languages and proving the model first. In this case, also media efforts will be more targeted.  
 
The proposal offers a realistic timetable to complete the work. The proposal provides a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how. 
The proposer has considered only one challenge regarding COVID relevant to a successful implementation. I believe there are more challenges to add such as multi-languages translation, sustainable revenue model and marketing.
f6_assessments.q2: A roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal, however mostly in a general way. It would have been good to have specific estimations for each deliverable for example Number of blogs/articles from IOG that are covered. The KPI of 100 members in 4 months is specific but what will it be in 6 months? Or 12 months? To align with the potential of the opportunity. As the proposal mention it is also about engagement with catalyst and not only members but what will be the estimated or targeted ratio? There is a clear understandable description of the targeted problem and a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem. Overall the community will be able to audit the progress of the proposal and the KPIs (although as I mentioned more specific numbers would have been helpful) - also considering the team is already in catalyst and in the Cardano ecosystem. This is why I still gave it 5 stars

f6_assessments.q0:
The overall aim of the proposal is to create a website that covers the vast majority of the population in India and make that content easily accessible. Since India is a multilingual country, it would be much more straightforward if the language or languages for the website is specified. In 2021 India is the 2nd country in terms of access and use of digital currency. However, people mostly know about Bitcoin, only few people know about Cardano. It is therefore a great chance to bring Cardano to India. India has about 5 million employees working in the IT industry, a very good potential for Cardano development. 
The plan and content have been carefully prepared, in clear sections, chapters, and sections. In addition to translation, they also plan to conduct promotions in the media, newspapers. There is still room for future development likes opening courses, forums. Some risks are correctly identified and some reasonable mitigation solutions have been proposed, enhancing the chance of project success. In conclusion, the proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Clear roadmap in term of month has been provided in the proposal. At this stage of proposal, a finer roadmap is expected, e.g., in term of week instead of in term of month. The requested budget is broken down into assessable details and sounds reasonable.  Founder team’s information is clearly provided in details with reference links for further verification, if needed. Experience and expertise of founder team are suitable for project development. In short, with the given experience and plan presented, it is possible that the proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: Definition of success and deliverables are defined for 3-4-6 months. It would be perfect if that of the first and second month be described. Qualitative KPIs are provided. At this stage of proposal, quantitative KPIs are expected to assess the audibility of the project. For example, one KPI is defined as the number of announcements from IOG that are covered. It would be quantifiable if the number of announcements from IOG that are covered is specified as criteria as project success. Proposals in a series of proposals have been funded previously. However, this proposal is new one and different from the funded one. In conclusion, from the information provided the audition of the progress and the success of the proposal are still questionable.

f6_assessments.q0:
India being a multilingual country where a large percentage speak just their mother tongue, this proposal seeks to create a website that has only Indian content and the Mentors will be experienced Cardano community members who also speak the mother tongue. This is a laudable idea. 
The aim of this proposal is to create content in Regional languages that covers the vast majority of the population in India and make that content easily accessible..
Addressing the challenge, which intends to grow the community of developers and educators, the proposed regional content will help native speakers to learn about Cardano. The website and communication channels will act as discussion forums and inform them about pioneer programs and how to get involved. The outreach activities will take the information to those who are not aware of Cardano. What is lacking is the ease of information access and guidance for the local population and the project intends to bridge that gap. There are more relevant information in the proposal. 
The main risk mentioned is that in case Covid variant worsens again, it will reduce availability of human resources and delay the delivery time. This challenge is well addressed by the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
The detailed plan and timeline are summarized as follows; Translate content to Regional languages as documents; translate selected announcements; design user journey; website development; set up a communication channel using discord and other social media outreach, share content, and more content in the proposal explaining how feasible it is. In my opinion, this project is very feasible and will lead to the onboarding of more Cardano members. 
The project is expected to start from June 2022 and last for 5 months and beyond. The activities and timeline have been scheduled appropriately in the proposal and very clear to understand.
 The sustainability of this project partly depends on catalyst Fund and other sources of revenue for expanding activities. 
The budget breakdown is clear and detailed in the proposal. Activities have been divided into variable costs for clarity. The total amount requested is USD29750 and it is reasonable. 
The team comprises 7 experts in software engineering, computer science, social entrepreneurship, R&D, language skills, etc. who are capable of delivering a successful project. The information provided will lead to a success in implementation of this project. My rating is 4.
f6_assessments.q2:
Measuring the progress of this project, the proposer has laid down the roadmap as 1st 3 months, 4 months, 6 months with different activities.
The KPIs for measuring success are the number of documents covering fundamentals of blockchain and Cardano in regional languages; number of articles from IOG; the number of announcements from IOG; the number of members joining the communication channels; the number of Twitter followers and number of videos in YouTube channel. This is a new proposal.
The information provided is sufficient for successful auditing, in my opinion. My rating is 4.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal effectively addresses the challenge by exposing Cardano to a larger audience in India. India has many different languages and cultures that should be included in the Cardano protocol. This proposal is well written and thought out. The proposal creates tools for Indian speakers of many different dialects increasing the outreach of Cardano in India. The proposal outlines creating "audio/visual content" which is a powerful media tool. The translated content will be delivered via the proposers website and on social media platforms such as YouTube.
f6_assessments.q1: The Core team are very experienced in marketing, design, programming, and journalism. The team is also well educated in the field of computer technology, including Plutus and prism pioneers in the group. All team members are from India and have a good understanding of Indian culture which is very important to succeed. I think the plan is well laid out and very likely to succeed all around. The funds will go a long way for their stated goals of website development, translating, and infrastructure. Youtube has a very large base of users that will leverage the information to a large group of people in India.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal outlines many KPI's to be met including, number of articles translated, outreach, and engagement. They also specify that milestones from roadmap can easily be tracked. I believe the information in this proposal is sufficient to audit the progress and success of this proposal. Youtube videos that are listed in this proposal can be measured by video views to measure engagement. Can track the amount of subscribers to the YouTube Channel to verify the project is reaching its stated goals.

solution: Create a website and content in Indian languages. Team members who are experienced in Cardano as well as native speakers to act as guides.
experience: Team of experienced software engineers, Plutus Pioneers, Prism Pioneers and Gimbalabs PPBL members, native speakers covering five major Indian languages. Members of a delivered Fund 6 project and funded proposers from Fund 7 with about a year's experience building on Cardano.
